intro: Hebe macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of violet or blue flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Hebe macrocalyx prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long flowering period and ability to thrive in a variety of garden conditions.
